snippet.title: Mayor's driving rap raising concerns
snippet.content:
SOUTHERN Midlands Deputy Mayor Alex Green said he would find it very difficult to continue in position of mayor if he were Tony Bisdee. Councillor Bisdee yesterday pleaded guilty to three counts of driving while his licence was suspended.
He also pleaded guilty to one count of exceeding the speed limit, three counts of driving an unregistered vehicle and one count of using a vehicle with no premium cover. Cr Green told ABC radio he had been responding to significant concerns from the Southern Midlands community over the Cr Bisdee's actions More to come ...
